div.p: is a framework that helps you to develop web based applications. A high level view of the system is given on this page. The framework consists of two more or less independend parts:

ul.li: A machinery to apply recusrsive XSLT transformations that produces the UI of the web application. You can learn more about this here.
A Java framework that takes input from the UI to change the application data and supplies changes of the application data back to the UI. This part is explained in much more detail here

div.p: Together, the framework acts similar to the Model-View-Controller pattern.

ul.li: The next version (released soon) will have rights management for the editor. Admins will be able to restrict users to edit only certain subprojects, while the possible use of one include by different subprojects will be taken care of with respect to the user's rights. More information on this will be available on the editor's documentation page.
